title: Children on the fringe (A)
creator_contributor_role: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre, production company
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Education, Preschool - Australia

description: Shows innovatory language stimulation techniques employed in a rural preschool designed for culturally disadvantaged part-Aboriginal and white children. Rationale, teaching strategies, evaluation and outcome are discussed. The relevance of the experiment for Australian preschool education is considered.
